page.title: 14FORESTRY IN BALQUHIDDER GLEN
page.content: The acquisition in 1940 of part of the Lands of Ledcreich by the Forestry Commission was the start of afforestation in Balquhidder Glen. Kirkton Glen and, more recently in 1975, Auchtuhbmore Hill have also been planted by the Forestry Commission. Larch and other coniferous trees with some broad leaved varieties makes the landscape interesting and colourful. As land use changes from sheep farming to forestry, private companies are also involved in planting trees, mainly on the south side of the glen. Notably on Muirlaggen Hill and behind Stronslaney. Public opinion differs on the desirability of the change of use of the land from hill farming to forestry. Undoubtedly the landscape today is very different to the heath and moorland of fifty years ago.
